They are not luxury rooms, but very good for the price. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They are constantly making upgrades to their rooms, which we notice each year.. A plus is their repeat guest discount of 10% each time you book a room. This comes in handy during these difficult financial times. The hotel restaurant has a wonderful menu, something for everyone. We make it a point to eat there during each stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: latyler04
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Sea Bay Hotel and we couldn't have had a better experience. We had four adults and 3 small children with us - the hotel was able to give us two adjoining rooms with two double beds in each room. After long days on the beach and swimming in the two pools at this hotel we were able to put the kids down in one room while the adults sat on the balcony enjoying the beautiful view of the bay! The hotel staff was EXTREMELY friendly, the rooms were clean and the cafe in the main building of the hotel serves a great breakfast. ...and best of all was the affordable price! It's only block away from the beach and located in the middle of Ocean City so you can get to the North or South streets relatively easy. (and if you’re traveling without children there’s a great nightclub/bar located less than a block away – Fager’s Island) There is no doubt in my mind that my family and I will stay here again - and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right, The Service is Great”
Reviews.Author: ABronxTale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three days in Ocean City and we booked into the Sea Bay. The Sea Bay is actually two seperate buildings. The main building and a back building facing the bay. I was in room 432 which had a bay view. The room had a microwave, coffee maker and nice sized fridge with no freezer compartment. The bed was ok but a little on the soft side as were the pillows. The room was sufficient for my wife and myself. The only problem I had with the back building was that there was only one elevator which is used by guests and staff. The pool was small and triangular in shape but seemed to be able to accomodate those that wanted to use it. The pool in the main building was larger and nicer, The balconey was nice but had cigarette butts from a previous guest soaking in the water run off from the A/C. The view of the bay was nice. The staff were always polite and courteous. There is a restaurant in the main building to get breakfast or lunch. The food, service and prices were decent. This is a nice place run by nice people. Remember the boardwalk in OC ends at 38th street. This hotel is on 60th street. You would need to drive or take the bus to get to the boardwalk attractions. For the price and service I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay For An Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: trish980
Reviews.Content: I wanted a spacious room for my family. The Sea Bay delivered with a large room with two beds and a pull-out sofa. The room was clean, fridge & micro in room. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice at a great price”
Reviews.Author: angelabby
Reviews.Content: We went on july 9th and stayed till july 12th. The room was super clean and staff was super nice. The second day of our trip it rained really bad and our belt came off of our mini van. That night two guys who worked for the hotel helped my boyfriend for an hour (with their own tools) to put our belt back on. We were so glad they were there to help or we might not have been able to get home. If we needed anything and called the hotel they were up in minutes. They had 2 pools which were very clean and the kids loved them. We ate at the cafe, the prices were cheap and the food was great. This will be the place we stay at from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: UAY
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in OC on business and stayed at Sea Bay for the first time. The staff were wonderful and treated me like an old friend. The room was huge, clean, quiet and the bed was comfortable. With the pull out sleep sofa, the room could have slept a family of four easily. There was plenty of onsite parking and the onsite Cafe was great. Really good food and fast, friendly service. The price was very reasonable and I wll be staying there again when I am in OC.

Reviews.Title: “WILL be returning!”
Reviews.Author: Leah M
Reviews.Content: I have nothing really bad to say about the Sea Bay Hotel. It exceeded our expectations in every which way. PLENTY of parking, friendly staff, clean rooms and beds (not to mention comfortable) and only a block away from the beach. Pool was nice and clean. You definitely get your money's worth! Quiet hotel as well, no noise to be concerned about which is nice when you want to relax. The only downside is that it's a little bit of a distance to the boardwalk, but it's not bad. We really enjoyed our stay at Sea Bay and will definitely be back later this year! I will certainly recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable experience, well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: jayjaymad
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our family vacation where we stayed at the Sea Bay Hotel. I must say weI were very impressed with the quality of service we had received fromt the staff. This was our first time staying in Ocean City and we were in need of recommendations on what to visit and where to eat. Two staff members, Jonathan and Elena, were extremely informative on these matters. They were very friendly, warm and personable and a joy to talk with. The hotel was clean, the restaurant cafe food was great, and the pool was just right on those hot days. We took full advantage of our balcony as it was very relaxing to enjoy the fresh air and to view the sunset . Jay and Madeline Simon.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MAG07081108
Reviews.Content: We traveled 6 hours to get to Ocean City. We arrived at our hotel that we had reservations for, there was a problem. They didn't have our reservations. So we were stuck 6 hours away with no where to stay. We drove around stopping in places and calling. We got the same answer everywhere, "no rooms available". So we drove past the Sea Bay and decided to stop. I followed a couple in. I heard them ask the front desk if they had a room for the night and she told them they had 1 more. My heart sank. If we couldn't get this place we were going to have to return home. Another person at the desk was there so I asked her if there was anything they could do for us, and I explained our situation. Well there was one room that they had been planning on maintenacing the following day, so they put us in that room and moved us first thing in the morning! I was so pleased! The whole entire staff was super friendly from the front desk clerks to the cleaning staff. They were very accomodating and everyone had a smile on their faces when we spoke to them. The rate was very reasonable too! Overall I was very impressed with our stay at the Sea Bay. And they saved our family trip!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will most definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: beachygirl54
Reviews.Content: I went down to OC with my daughter for a long weekend. I'd been to OC many times and stayed at various hotels over the years. My first trip to this particular hotel was last summer and we had a pretty okay time so we decided to come back again. The rooms are mostly clean and the beds decent. The hotel is also in the center of OC -- away from the hustle and bustle of the boardwalk but not too far away. The hotel is nice although not spectacular, but where they really excel is customer service. The maids and the front desk staff were very accommodating. Especially Lesley at the front desk. She was the one who has both booked our reservations for the past two summers AND checked us in. She was friendly, answered every single question we had and always made sure we were more than comfortable the entire stay by providing us with extra towels, blankets, pillows and even a toothbrush and toothpaste because my daughter forgot hers. All in all it was a nice hotel with an excellent front desk staff. I will be calling very soon to book with Lesley our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sea Bay...we'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanNY85
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went down to Ocean City for Memorial Day weekend. Sea Bay was a great find for us. It's located right off the bridge when you get in. And it's located right down the street from a few fun bars we checked out. The rooms were clean and the service was pretty good. Nice staff and also really liked the breakfast place that they have in the hotel. We'll definitely be coming back later this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KanoSilverSpring
Reviews.Content: This Spring, we spent a girl's weekend in Ocean City and stayed at the Sea Bay Hotel. The accommodations were nice, the staff was helpful in recommending places to go, and the rooms that we stayed in had been recently renovated. Just booked a trip with my husband bor later this Summer and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Prariedon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for memorial day weekend. After turing in for the night I found out the room had bed bugs. They looked like baby roaches but these bite. The staffs suggestion to resolve the problem was to change the sheets. After insisting they did place me in a new room. Thats all that was offered. Disappointed. The fridge dripped water. No other problems to report for such a cheap room.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: maverick1lc
Reviews.Content: The Sea Bay Hotel was the only hotel we could book last minute for Labor Day Weekend so we didn't have very high standards. It was a pleasant surprise though! The staff was extremely friendly, and our room was ready 5 hours earlier than check-in because we arrived there so early. The room was clean and larger than we had anticipated, with two double beds, a couch, and a table with two chairs. We also had a balcony with two chairs. The bathroom was very clean, as were the linens. There is a small pool outside, perfect for the amount of guests, and a nice dip in the way back from the beach. The only problem is really the location, you have to cross a busy road and walk two blocks to get to the beach, and it is a 15-20 minute bus ride to get to the boardwalk. All in all though, it was a pleasant stay, budget-friendly, and perfect for a small group of friends to have a relaxing labor day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “BEST place to stay in OC...”
Reviews.Author: sandollar82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends for two nights this past July...and plan on staying here the next time I need a room in OC! The rooms were clean, balcony was great, and you can't beat the location. Within short walking distance of all the great hangouts...Seacrets, Fager's Island, and Mackeys. Also a short walk to the Holiday Inn pool bar. Great way to save time and money...no need to jump on the "drunk bus" or hail a cab when it's time to head out for the evening. AND it's right next to the Route 90 bridge so you can make a quick exit when you're ready to leave. All in all, a good choice if you're looking for a reasonable priced hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Room and Bed, plus fresh delightful coffee with cream in lobby.”
Reviews.Author: ksummer
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Sea Bay Hotel was very pleasant. The staff was wonderful and genuine. The room was large and comfortable. The bed was so comfortable I actually looked forward to the end of the fun day rather than dreading it like I have done at other hotels. I am a single mom with some health issues that the hotel was aware of prior to my arrival. After check in I realized that they put me in a room VERY close to the elevator. That is great customer service. The coffee offered in the Hotel's lobby was always fresh. There is tea there as well. The decor is not super fancy, however, the comfort,service and reasonable rates make the Sea Bay Hotel a place I will definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PABooks22
Reviews.Content: After roaming the internet looking for a decently priced(and a place that wasn't teeming with rowdy college kids) hotel I came across the Sea Bay. I read the reviews on here and decided to go for it. The price was a bit higher then I would have liked but still a good deal. It was located a few blocks from two big attractions; Seacrets and Fagers Island. You could easily walk to both. It was also a few blocks away from the grocery store and several other "known" places to eat. Another added bonus was that it is RIGHT off of Route 90, which is a nice benefit. The beach is 1 or 2 blocks from the hotel and was not crowded at all. It was an easy walk. There were PLENTY of parking spaces(often an issue in ocmd) and we got to park right next to the entrance to our building(the hotel has an A and a B building). We stayed in Building B, in a bayview king. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the room was quiet spacious. The AC and fridge both functioned properly. The view and balcony were great. The bed was also comfortable. I have a few minor grievances but those go along with any place and probably would not stop me from going back. 1-you can hear doors slamming of the rooms around, up and down from you. This didn't keep my boyfriend or I up but it was noticeable throughout the day and in the evening. 2-cleanliness of the bathroom. I did notice several long black hairs on the tub wall, bathroom wall and stuck to the hair dryer. This wasn't a super huge deal. I just washed them down the drain. 3-pool size. Nothing super spectacular but the fact they do have 2 pools helps a bit. Overall, I was happy with my stay at the Sea Bay. They knew Hurricane Bill was approaching(with warnings of rip currents and high tides) and posted information on the weather throughout the hotel. Each building has a separate checkout, which is helpful as well. I didn't catch the name of the man who checked us out on 8/23/09 in Building B around 10:00am but he was very pleasant and helpful. My boyfriend and I have already talked about how if we had to Ocean City again we have no problem staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: lchilenski
Reviews.Content: Our family had a wonderful vacation here. Our room was very nice and the girls who did the housekeeping were very good and professional. The front desk staff was also very helpful and knowledgable about the areas restaurants and attractions. This was our first trip to Ocean City and my husband and i fell in love with it! We plan on many more family vacations there. Short walk to beach, bay, shops and restaurants were also a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Impression!!!”
Reviews.Author: eekaMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sea Bay for one night in Aug. It was the first time we had stayed there and did not know anyone who had previously stayed there. When searching for a place to stay, I found the Sea Bay to be the most reasonable place that I came across. When I called to inquire more about the rooms, Shelly was very helpful, courteous and a pleasure to speak with. Our room was clean, spacious and in a good location. We also enjoyed the two pools option amenity as well. Overall we had a very nice stay and wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: erm295
Reviews.Content: As a repeat quest we have once again had a very positive stay at the Sea Bay. Our room was very nice and roomy, the staff was more than helpful if we needed something extra, and with the location of the hotel we were centrally located for what our activities are. The gift certificates that came with our package we booked were a very nice addition to our stay and our wallet. For our next trip to Ocean City we will certainly be looking at the Sea Bay for rates and rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: saramary
Reviews.Content: we stayed only 2 nights and 3 days at the sea bay hotel in maryland. we thought it was a great hotel not too expensive especially with the large room we got and the balcony which we loved. The room was very clean had a couch, 2 double beds, a clean bathroom with a nice size shower, a tv with cable channels, a little table to sit at and also a mini kitchen. The pool downstairs was very clean and relaxing and the also have a very good restaurant at the hotel which was very good and the staff is very friendly. the hotel was one block away from the beach but one mile away from the boardwalk but we took a bus there which is right outside the hotel. ti sum it up i would stay again we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Dino1959
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sea Bay 3 times now and find that for the money, it's great. The rooms are large and usually very clean. It has 2 pools (one is small and overlooks the bay-beautiful at sunset). The management tries to be as accommodating as possible. Our room was ready early and we were able to check in-it was a Monday. Also, I had trouble with the fridge and they sent someone up within 5 minutes of my asking. On the downside-the walls are thin and you can hear TV's and kids (if they are being loud) and the bathrooms could use some updating. It has a great restaurant in the building for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average!!!”
Reviews.Author: claycraftsman
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Seabay last week and soon realized that it was a mismanaged hotel. One evening we walked out of the room tried to get back in, but the key did not work. When my wife who is 5 months pregnant with twins and I tried to get a new key made at the front desk. The so called manager Holly was working and had informed us that we could not go back to our room! Our cell phones and everything were in the room and she told us that our names weren't registered. There was a man who came up to me and pulled his shirt up to show me his cool badge!! He than insinuated that my wife and I were freeloading in someone else's room!! Funny I paid CASH at the front desk where you would register. The so called security gaurd doesn't even have the power to watch a paying customer go to the room to get the receipt showing that we are who we are. Needless to say after 45 minutes, and my pregnant wife who was stressed over the whole thing and I were allowed back into our room!! I tried to contact the General Manager and still have yet to hear from him. I am in the hotel industry and I would never recommend the seabay to anyone!! The lights in the room don't work, the balcony door comes off track everyother time you go to use it!! I even tried to give the General Manager a week to respond back and try to make things right, I guess he is so busy overseeing two properties wow you deserve the dillegence award and maybe an award for most dated hotel on bayside!

Reviews.Title: “Good all around stay and great prices.”
Reviews.Author: jessi5
Reviews.Content: I love going to O.C. Md. with my kids. However I can't always afford the stay at a hotel/motel. I found the Sea Bay Hotel and checked the reviews, so I went for it. I am glad that I did. It was a great price, very affordable for the time of year. The rooms are clean, the staff is great and location is good. It is not in the middle of everything, but close enough. I stayed with my 7 year old son and 14 year old daughter who took a friend. We did have a problem with partying neighbors the first nite, but it was taken care of right away. The staff told me they do not have a tolerance for that. The staff was also very friendly, always asking how we where and if everyhing was ok. I enjoyed my stay that much that I will go back again. This is the first that I have ever taken the time to write a review about any place I have stayed. That should say something. FYI: Hall's is a great resteraunt next to the hotel, but very expencive. Try Ember's, it is more food for less money. I make sure we eat there every time we go to O.C.

Reviews.Title: “Overall okay stay”
Reviews.Author: mariafw
Reviews.Content: While I usually like better hotels, this one was okay. We had booked in another hotel that was disgusting so this was a step up for us. The room was clean though the ceiling panels in the bathroom was rusty. The bed was okay - not the most comfortable but not the worst. However, it is a big room and we had alot of space for the two kids including the pack and play for my little one. They still had alot of room to run. The staff was nice. We had a newer TV in our room though the other room we looked at did not. The other room had newer microwave and refrigerator while our room had a really old microwave and refrigerator but both worked fine. The Best Western was more modern (they are next to each other almost) but had no pool so we opted for the Sea Bay as it had a small pool. Ironically, we never used the pool. The restaurant attached to it is good for breakfast - there are menus at the front desk that give you 50% off the second entree.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: pooh2268
Reviews.Content: Everyone was friendly and always had smiles on their faces!!!! It was also nice that they gave our 2 small children sand buckets and beach balls. Had a nice relaxing stay, and will go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: june321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sea Bay for 3 nights. The pools were lovely and the staff was very friendly and always willing to help. The exterior of the hotel was very well kept and the room we had was small, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Best place in town.”
Reviews.Author: ShanLav
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Located walking distance from one of the best Bars in O.C. The rooms are always clean, and the staff is super accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieCNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Sea Bay Hotel made my weekend getaway with my husband and another couple a wonderful experience! I had heard good things from a few friends that had been there and I am so happy I took their word for it. The staff was so helpful and made sure to ask how we were doing at all times. Our room and the entire hotel was very clean. Location is perfect for a night out and near many great restaurants. (Fager's Island is our favorite and the Sea Bay is a two minute walk) I am already trying to stay there again in July.

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap for Ocean City, that's all it has going for it”
Reviews.Author: captmike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a lacrosse tournament. Place is rundown, dirty, noisy (traffic and otherwise), small pool, and the list goes on. I can't fathom who or why anyone would rate this more than a two, and that would be a stretch in any area other that OC. Yeah, it's cheap ($175), but to rate it a 3.5? Ocean City has a problem, and it's that pretty much all the hotels in the city are awful or incredibly overpriced. I pray that when the Marriott Courtyard opens that they adhere to Marriott's standard of quality and can keep the nightly rate under $300/night. I'd like to come to Ocean City more often, but only come when I absolutely have to because of the seedy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Terpfan48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sea Bay May 16 - 18, 2009 for a golf weekend. Kathy, who helped us book our trip, was extremely helpful and went the extra mile for us. Three rounds of golf (Baywood Greens, Bay Club and Bear Trap Dunes) two nights and two breakfasts cost us $369 - a price we considered a real bargain. Because it was "Cruzin" weekend, every place else we contacted was demanding a 3 night minimum stay. The rooms were a little dated, but still clean and large. The mini fridge, microwave and wet bar were convenient. I found the staff to be very friendly, even the maids. I was surprised to read other reviews about a rude staff. Friendly and polite goes both ways. The restaurant was on the first floor and opened early. The service was prompt and friendly and the food was good. I don't know about the prices because the breakfasts were included in the package, but I can't imagine it would be any more than any place else in OC. Yes, it was loud on Saturday night because of all of the classic cars cruising Coastal Highway, but that's what this particular weekend is all about. Do some research before you head to OC if you're not into it. It's not my thing, but I still enjoyed seeing all of the different cars. I wasn't going to let a little noise ruin my weekend. The hotel is within walking distance of Fagers, Seacrets, Mackeys and Castaways, so if you're going to have some drinks, take my advice and get the exercise or take a taxi. I saw a few cars that were stopped as the OC police do not tolerate DWI (does anyone?). There is really no need to get behind the wheel. There's a 7-11 within 100 yards of the hotel and the Rt.90 bridge is one block away. JR Ribs and Tubby's right across the street, so A+ on the location. You can do much worse in OC, so be fair and don't expect a 5 star hotel at a 3 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place,enjoyable visit!”
Reviews.Author: aspen1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Spring Fest too! I agree with the previous person 100%. We have noticed improvements the last few years and have stayed here at least 4 different times at different times of the year. Our room was on the bayside 3rd floor with a beautiful view of the bay. Room was large and clean. We had to move from the original room on the 4th,due to mildue in the room but we notified front desk and service was excellent in relocating us to another room immediatly on the 3rd. Front desk is always professional. Plenty of parking. The outdoor pool was open, but too cold to go into. This hotel is at a great location mid-town. Restaurant in hotel had delicious food. We got french toast with powered sugar one day,waffle the next with eggs and bacon on both days. I highly recommend this place. It beats staying at the Hilton or the new Marriott at 300-400 per night in season.

Reviews.Title: “Springfest 2009”
Reviews.Author: bingo42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at the Sea Bay Hotel for Springfest. Over the years I have stayed at this hotel many times. For me it offers a great location, pool, pleasant staff, and is in a quiet area on the bayside. Since my last visit many improvements have been made. Some I noticed were new windows in the hallways in the Sea Bay Inn building. Updated lobby area. Improvements to the pool area at the Sea Bay Inn building. Security staff in the hotel and around the parking areas throughout the night! The staff was as friendly and helpful as ever. The hotel offers affordable prices, central location in OC, you can walk to Hall's for a breakfast buffet, head down to Fager's Island for lunch, dinner, or drinks at night ( within walking distance) and there is a 7-Eleven located one block away for any last minute items you might need. It is clear the people who run this property are working hard to improve it where needed and maintain the good service they have provided for years. Best Wishes to them for the 2009 season.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive golf package experience”
Reviews.Author: lagtime13
Reviews.Content: We decided on a golf trip to Ocean City and booked with Sea Bay because Kathy was so helpful and thoughtful and the package price was terrific -blew others away. We were initially concerned because of some of the reviews. We found the service to be good (met our few needs) the room was spacious and very clean as was the hotel in general. It was extremely convenient to all the courses we were playing. Overall our experience was positive enough that we are booking next years golf excursion with Sea Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Made my Anniversary celebration one to remember”
Reviews.Author: tdb22
Reviews.Content: Staff provided excellent attention to detail for a party of 32 people from out of town. Within walking distance to beach, restaurants and night life. Even provided a breakast the next day.

Reviews.Title: “filthy”
Reviews.Author: steve26London
Reviews.Content: how do these other people give this place 4/5.???????? it was the dirtiest place i have ever been in. i was in the room for 20 seconds and went to the desk to ask for a refund. the room stunk and looked like it was about to be condemmed. i now wonder about the validity of these reviews. i feel sure the good reviews are written buy the hotel owners and staff. i would not let my dog sleep there. not worth $1 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay......”
Reviews.Author: Jaugstetter
Reviews.Content: My son plays for an AAU basketball team and we attended a tournament held in Ocean City. We spent a weekend at the Sea Bay and I had some reservations after reading a few of the reviews. Fortunately, my family and I didn't experience any of the problems that previous guests have encountered. Before you book your room, it does help to know the set-up of the hotel. The hotel is actually two separate buildings (A and B). Building A is the old Best Western and contains the main lobby and has an outdoor pool. Building B (where we stayed) is the old Sea Bay motel and also has a smaller, separate outdoor pool. I can't comment on the rooms in Building A, but the building is closer to a very busy main drag (Ocean Ave.) and the pool seemed to be much more crowded in Building A. Building B is on the Bay side and has a number of rooms which have a nice view of the Bay and the pool. Our room faced the parking lot, which wasn't a bad thing, but I know that a few of the families in our party upgraded their rooms to a Bay view when they checked in. I believe they were charged a few dollars more, but it is worth it. Each room in the building has a balcony and the balconies on the Bay side rooms are larger. I was pleasantly surprised when we first walked into the room. The room was very spacious and contained a sitting area, microwave and refrigerator. The microwave and refrigerator were brand new and spotless. The bathroom looked to have been recently renovated with a brand new sink, countertop and shower stall. A hairdryer, soaps and plenty of towels were also provided. The only downside to the room was that the beds were full beds. Queen sized beds would have been nice. The lobby of Building B has a nice sitting area where free coffee is provided in the morning. The lobby area leads to the pool which is smaller than the main pool in Building A, but is much less crowded. The pool area also has a great view of the Bay. The staff was very efficient and gracious when I asked for local restaurant recommendations and directions. One of our party actually had a problem with the air conditioner not working in their room. When they returned from lunch, the maintenance staff had pulled out the old A/C and replaced it with a brand new unit! I was impressed. Be aware that you have to cross Ocean Ave. to get to the beach. Ocean Ave. is actually a four lane road which has the feel of a highway. Walk south one block and cross at the light. If you don't, you'll be dodging cars like the old Frogger video game. Also, you will have to drive to the Boardwalk. The Boardwalk starts on 28th St. and goes South to 1st. St. Municipal parking is located on 1st. and is reasonably priced and usually has spaces available. A few restaurants to visit would be Phillips Seafood (the lunch menu is more reasonably priced) and a fun place to eat is On The Bay Crabhouse. We ate outdoors and got the "all you can eat" crab special. It gets messy, but it is a fun experience. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Sea Bay in Ocean City and I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmm_travels
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Sea Bay because it was in close proximity to a wedding we attended. It happened to correspond to "Cruizin' Weekend", so some of the issues we had were due to the overwhelming "cruisers" in Ocean City that w/e. The hotel staff greeted us with rude behavior and utter lack of professionalism. I even said to them that their behavior was likely a huge contributor to the poor ratings the hotel receives on TripAdvisor. They did not seem to care. Our room was bare bones and in bad need of update and repair. In general, the kind of room of where you don't want to touch the bedspreads and/or the carpet or corners of the shower stall. The towels were threadbare and so rough, they hurt your skin to dry off. The worst part of the hotel was the noise level. We were given a room in the "Building B" (set back further than the Main Building from Coastal Highway - but with only a parking lot between the building and the highway). Our room happened to be facing the parking lot/highway instead of the Bay. The "cruisers" revved their engines and generally blasted up and down the strip from 5:30am until 5:30am. 24 hours. Needless to say, we got very little sleep this weekend. We were told that to change rooms to a room facing the bay, there would be an additional charge. Not a single person at the hotel mentioned that Cruisin' Weekend would be taking place during our stay. As we were clearly with a wedding party and not part of the car show festivities, it would have helped us immensely to know about such a loud and disruptive event going on. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: kdogg_1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of March 29th for a golf trip. The rooms we had were the ones with the 2 double beds and pull out sofa. We were in the 1st building (the old best western sea bay inn). They were a pretty good size. The water pressure in the shower was excellent and the mini fridge and microwave were convenient. The only negative think I could see is that the decor inside the rooms (bedding, rugs, curtains) need some major updating. The hotel is easily walkable to Fagers Island, Mackys, and Seacrets. We did not eat at the restaurant and I thought the hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgable of the Ocean City area. I would not be hesitant to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTraveler75
Reviews.Content: We were in Building B, which is farther back from Coastal Highway. The "Bayfront" rooms are really bay front, but they do afford a nice view of a small inlet populated with herons and other birds. The rooms are larger than one would expect, and have balconies. This hotel is among the more affordable in Ocean City. While the hotel is clean, there is a certain lingering dinginess about it, probably due to uneven maintenance. The rooms seem like they are made up of spare parts from some other hotel -- e.g., the furniture and the chairs don't really match.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!!! Read this!!”
Reviews.Author: skyte
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware!!! 2 Major things sucked at this hotel: 1. Misleading amenities. 2. Poor staff service. The website said that all rooms included certain amenities. When we showed up there was NO: - Iron/Ironing Board -coffee maker -wetbar -hair dryer -or sofa I called the front desk after entering the room and told the person that there was no coffee maker in the room. The person said that that room was not supposed to have one and acted like I was making an unusual request to have one. An hour later i realized that we didn't have the iron or ironing board either. So i called again and the person said that our room wasn't supposed to have that either. I told the person about the website saying these COMMON Amenities would be here and he mumbled something about me staying in the second building. Like I was supposed to have known that already??? Only 1 of their building's comes with any amenities? The worst part is that one day the maids knocked twice when we were still sleeping and I told them to come back. They came back the second time, and i said we were still sleeping, and they insisted to replace our towels. So i got out of bed to do that. Then, 2 hours later it was 12pm, i called the front desk to request that the maids come to replace our sheets because we were ready now. The person seemed stumped that i would ask this. Hesitated on the phone and stumbled when saying they would send someone over to do this. No one ever came to our room to replace the sheets. Hated this hotel. Will never stay again! Buyer Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Fair priced”
Reviews.Author: Vicky22310
Reviews.Content: My stay during the last week of June was fantastic. The Inn is right of Rt 90 and was in walking distance to the beach, entertainment, shopping and good places to eat. No, it is not the Ritz but it is clean and roomy. When I visited they were still in the process of some remodeling. Booking was easy on their web page. I called to confirm a week before the trip - yes they had all my information and rate that I booked it for correct. We had a wonderful stay. It was very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: mckinley1
Reviews.Content: If you're just looking for a place to shower and sleep, then the Sea Bay Inn will do the job. The location is great - 1 block from the beach and an easy car/bus ride to the boardwalk. Nice bars on the bay are within walking distance - Castaways, Fager's Island, Mackey's, and Seacrets. The front desk was very friendly - the maids were NOT! Our first morning there, my boyfriend and I went out for breakfast and a walk. Around 11:45, we were going to start getting ready for the beach when the cleaning staff knocked on the door. We asked if we could have a half hour and the woman said, "No, we're leaving in 10 minutes." They just did towels and trash. Getting a smile or a "good morning" out of them was like pulling teeth. The room was kind of small. There was no hotel guide with numbers in it, that you would normally find at a hotel. If you're looking for a classic hotel experience with good service and clear organization, I'd search somewhere else. However, our room was clean and we felt safe during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definatly returning next year!”
Reviews.Author: xprettyxeyesx
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location, great price, and great quality. The maids tended to be a little grouchy but other than that, NOTHING to complain about!... Our room was clean upon arrival, nice balcony, pool was a good temperature, just across the street from the beach!.... I however would not recommend going to hall's restuarant diagonal from the hotel. My boyfriend and I went there for their breakfast buffet, the food wasn't very good and we both were sick the whole way home. Other than that, awesum trip and having a wonderful, affordable hotel to stay in just added to a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Tough on the Nose”
Reviews.Author: DMarrara
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and only paid $39 (off season), but I'm glad we didn't need to stay longer. The fragrance that other posters mentioned is breathtaking. I asked two different staff people what the scent was and where it came from and neither had an answer. It is powerful! It made the stay uncomfortble. The rooms need some work. The carpet didn't go all the way to the wall and it left furring strips exposed. The walls were marked up; I hope it wasn't dirt. The bathrooms are old and look it. The grout was mildewy, like it tends to get at the beach. One of the ceiling tiles was wet and I reported it to the front desk. To their credit, they offered to move us to another room. The bed was comfortable and if we had stayed longer I'm sure we would have used the fridge and microwave. Keeping the smell in mind, we'll stay somewhere else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: enathan119
Reviews.Content: The room was a nice size and the mini fridge & microwave were definitely convenient. 1 block to Fagers Island, which was nice. The restaurant was overpriced (like many other things in OC). Our key card stopped working during our trip so we went to the front desk & discovered they had deactivated it too soon, but they took care of it quickly. The shower was the only really bad thing about the room - it shot out so hard, it stung! In terms of location, we used the bus, which is $2/person/day. It's about a 20-25 min bus ride to the heart of the boardwalk, depending on traffic. At this price, I would probably stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here from June 23-25, and we had a great time. The lobby was cozy and the staff was extreamly friendly. The room was a nice size and could sleep up to 6 people. The rates were REALLY good as well. There is a resturant next door that opens at 6am and the food and sevice were also very good. If you are going to OC for a few days and don't want to spend alot of money for a place to stay and still feel comfortable, then I would recommend this one for you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here with my boyfriend during Senior Week in 2003 because my place (The Spindrift) was absolutely horrible. It was a very nice room, spacious and clean. My only problem was the very strong scent, not a horrible scent, like a deodorizer or something, just very strong, but that's how you knew the room was cleaned that day. Because we kept forgetting to put up the do not disturb sign and slept in everyday (whoops!) the maid kept coming in by accident, but was very polite and would give us towels for our showers and then leave us alone. The pool wasn't all that (size wise), but it was clean. Over all, it was a pleasant stay... much better than the place I was originally staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Sea Bay, O.C. MD”
Reviews.Author: Suebjazz
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at the Best Western Sea Bay was fair. I don't like to complain, but there are some things that need to be complained about. As we entered our room there was an over-powering floral scent. I could not find an air freshener anywhere so the scent must have been coming out of the air conditioner. It was so over-powering that it made me ill. After a while you get used to it, but believe me when I say it's over powering! Another review that I read a while back said the same thing. To alleviate the problem I had to open the sliding glass door to the balcony. When I did that the flies starting to fly on in! On the up side, the room was a nice size and it had a mini fridge and a microwave. We had breakfast in their restaurant and although it was a bit pricey, it was good. On the down side, the room was in need of detail cleaning, especially in the bathroom. The hotel location is quite far from everything. It's 60 blocks to the board walk and you have to walk across Coastal Highway to access the beach. The lights are long. I'd say it's a good hotel for a quick over nighter, but if you're staying for a couple of days, stay in a hotel closer to the boardwalk. If you stay further up where we were on 60th St., I'd recommend staying in a hotel on the beach side of Coastal Highway. It will be much more enjoyable and convenient for you.
